page.title: 07HORBURY PEOPLE - PAST
page.content: Although only a small area in terms of population,Horbury had quite a rich collection of remarkable people. The known are John Carr and the Reverend Baring Gould. John Carr,an architect,is responsible for designing Harewood House,the grandstand at York Racecource and the impressive St Peters church in Horbury. He lived from 1723 to 1807 and rose to become Lord Mayor of York. Baring -Gould wrote the popular hymn "Onward Christian Soldiers" for a church march between Horbury Bridge and Horbury in 1864.In addition he wrote a number of novels which featured locations in the Horbury area.
